definitions.definition: To appreciate without jealousy or greed .
examples: I fancy your new car, but I like my old one just fine.

definitions.definition: Would like ; have a desire for.
examples: I fancy a burger tonight for dinner.
Do you fancy going to town this weekend?

definitions.definition: To be sexually , aesthetically or romantically attracted to.
examples: I fancy that girl over there.
[dated] I fancy you'll want something to drink after your long journey.
I fancy this is an error.
Fancy that! I saw Elizabeth Bennett and Mr. Darcy kissing in the garden.
You won't get the gig just because you fancy yourself a musician.
labels: dated or in a set phrase
definitions.label_groups: dated or in a set phrase

definitions.definition: To form a conception of; to portray in the mind.
To have a fancy for; to like; to be pleased with, particularly on account of external appearance or manners.

main_definition: ( formal ) To appreciate without jealousy or greed .
secondary_definitions: ( British ) Would like ; have a desire for.
( British , informal ) To be sexually , aesthetically or romantically attracted to.
( dated or in a set phrase ) To imagine , suppose .
To form a conception of; to portray in the mind.
To have a fancy for; to like; to be pleased with, particularly on account of external appearance or manners.
( transitive ) To breed (animals) as a hobby.
